subSections.title: Kanji
Readings
Compounds
subSections.text:
{{der-top|Compounds}}
'''Kun'yomi''':
* {{ja-r|楓科|かえでか}}: the maple family, ''[[Aceraceae]]''
* {{ja-r|楓棚|かえでだな}}: a type of shelf in a ''[[tokonoma]]'' or study, with four legs and eight shelves
* {{ja-r|楓鳥|かえでちょう}}, {{ja-r|カエデチョウ|かえでちょう}}: the {{vern|black-rumped waxbill}}, a type of {{vern|estrildid finch}} common in Africa and introduced to Japan in the 1960s
* {{ja-r|楓鳥科|かえでちょうか}}, {{l|ja|カエデチョウ科|かえでちょうか}}: [[genus]] ''[[Estrilda]]''
* {{ja-r|楓紅葉|かえで もみじ}}: maple leaves that have turned red in autumn; a style of layered clothing with light yellow-green on the outside and yellow or orange-red on the inside
'''On'yomi''':
* {{ja-r|楓蚕|ふうさん}}: alternate for {{m|ja|天蚕蛾|tr=tegusuga||Japanese silkworm moth, {{taxlink|Antheraea yamamai|species|noshow=1}}}}
* {{ja-r|風樹|ふうじゅ}}: the {{vern|Formosan gum tree}}; the maple
* {{ja-r|楓糖|ふうとう}}: [[maple syrup]]
* {{ja-r|楓葉|ふうよう}}: maple leaves that have turned red in autumn
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|カエデ}} {{wikipedia|Maple}} [[File:Acer_palmatum_002.JPG|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|楓}} (''kaede''): '''[[maple]]''' leaves and seeds.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かえで}} Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=かえで|蛙|tr1=kaeru|t1=frog|手|tr2=te|t2=hand}}, with the ''te'' changing to ''de'' due to {{rendaku|かえで}}, and the ''ru'' dropping out over time. From the way the [[palmate]] leaves resemble a frog's foot.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}{{R:Daijirin}}

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|かえで|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: {{U:ja:biology|カエデ}}

subSections.title: Derived terms
Proper noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|proper|かえで}}

# {{given name|female|lang=ja|sort=かえで}}.

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かいで}}
Shift in pronunciation of ''kaede''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|かいで}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|かいで}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かいで|uncommon}} alternative for ''kaede'' above: the [[maple]] tree

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|カツラ (植物)}} {{wikipedia|Cercidiphyllum japonicum}} [[File:Cercidiphyllum_japonicum2.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|楓}} (''katsura''): '''[[katsura]]''' leaves and seeds.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かつら}} From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=かつら}}. Less common spelling for {{m|ja|桂|tr=''katsura''}}.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|かつら|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text:
{{U:ja:biology|カツラ}}

The ''katsura'' reading is rare for this kanji. When referring to the ''katsura'' tree, the {{ja-l|桂}} spelling is used more often to avoid confusion.

subSections.title: Etymology 4
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|おかつら}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=おかつら}}. Alternate spelling for {{m|ja|男桂|tr=okatsura||male katsura}}, an archaic name for the katsura tree.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Compare {{m|ja|女桂|tr=mekatsura||female katsura: the cinnamon tree}}. Appears with this reading in the {{m|ja|和名類聚抄|tr={{w|Wamyō Ruijushō}}}}, a Japanese dictionary of Chinese characters completed in 938.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|おかつら}}

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|おかつら|hhira=をかつら}} {{ja-altread|hira=おかづら|rom=okazura}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=おかつら|obsolete}} the [[katsura]] tree, ''[[Cercidiphyllum japonicum]]''

subSections.title: Etymology 5
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|フウ}} {{wikipedia|Liquidambar formosana}} [[File:Liquidambar_formosana_02.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|楓}} (''fū''): '''[[sweetgum]]''' leaves and seeds.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ふう}} From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ふう}} {{m|zh|楓|tr=biung}}.
